header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description: Get information about a logged-in employer. This URI returns all groups tied to the given login. Employers have access to members only at the group level, but they may not have access to PHI for some groups, while having it for others.

Get information about a logged-in employer. This URI returns all groups tied to the given login. Employers have access to members only at the group level, but they may not have access to PHI for some groups, while having it for others.

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description: Get information about a logged-in employer. This URI returns all groups tied to the given login. Employers have access to members only at the group level, but they may not have access to PHI for some groups, while having it for others.
Use one type of member ID to retrieve other types of ID data for a member, such as subscriber ID, suffix, member CK, and subscriber CK.

variable.description: Allowed values: byLoginId, byMemberId, byMemberCk, bySubscriberCk, bySubscriberId.

request.description: Use one type of member ID to retrieve other types of ID data for a member, such as subscriber ID, suffix, member CK, and subscriber CK.

variable.description: Allowed values: byLoginId, byMemberId, byMemberCk, bySubscriberCk, bySubscriberId.

query.description: Lookup benefits as of the supplied date. If not specified, today's date is used.

Use this binary flag to group and sort benefit data to the needs of the UI. Allowed values 0-7.Default value is 0.
1 = Group service details by class. If this is false, service classes and details will appear in separate arrays.
2 = Group service details into pairs by in-network and out-of-network costs.
4 = Sort data automatically. If this is false, a "sortOrder" property is returned in each object.
Combine values to achieve the desired output. For example, to group details by class and sort automatically, deliver 5 for this value.

request.description: Details for a group. User must have access to the group in Xperm. For subgroup listing, use /subgroups.
List subgroups. Only subgroups that are active as of the specified date will be displayed.

Get information about a logged-in broker. This URI lists all the active commission arrangements tied to the broker login. Commission arrangements give a broker access to either individuals at the subscriber level, or to entire groups. There may be some overlap between active commissions. Broker permissions are **time-sensitive** with regards to PHI - only claims & authorizations from the time period the broker is active should be shown.

variable.description: Allowed values: byLoginId, byMemberId, byMemberCk, bySubscriberCk, bySubscriberId.

query.description: Lookup benefits as of the supplied date. If not specified, today's date is used.

1 = Group service details by class. If this is false, service classes and details will appear in separate arrays.
2 = Group service details into pairs by in-network and out-of-network costs.
4 = Sort data automatically. If this is false, a "sortOrder" property is returned in each object.
Combine values to achieve the desired output. For example, to group details by class and sort automatically, deliver 5 for this value.

Check the values of important service settings and the status of server resources. This test point is more accurate than using the WAS console, as the connections are tested on the actual application server instead of the NodeAgent.

Refresh the service's AppSettings cache and clear all DynaCaches.
**NOTE:** If making changes to application settings, make sure to refresh SettingsManagement **before** calling this function.
